snippet: Twitter has agreed to identify several users who posted anti-Semitic comments on its service, and whom French authorities are seeking to prosecute for violating that country’s anti-hate laws.
abstract: Twitter, yielding to pressure from French authorities, agrees to identify several users who posted anti-Semitic comments on its service; case shows how challenging it is for Silicon Valley companies to champion free speech rights of users while complying with laws of countries where they do business.
lead_paragraph: Twitter has agreed to identify several users who posted anti-Semitic comments on its service, and whom French authorities are seeking to prosecute for violating that country’s anti-hate laws.

headline.main: Twitter Yields to Pressure in Hate Case in France
headline.print_headline: Twitter Yields To Pressure In Hate Case In France
